definitions: To extract or remove something from a place or container.
To withdraw from an activity, agreement, or commitment.
To move a vehicle out from the side of the road or from a parking space.
To depart or leave a place, especially a train or other public transport.
examples: She had to pull out a splinter from her finger.
The company decided to pull out of the deal.
He watched the train pull out of the station.
The driver began to pull out into traffic.
